description.blurb: On the way to its primary mission, NEAR performed a 25-minute flyby of the asteroid 253 Mathilde on June 27, 1997. The closest approach was about 750 miles (1,200 kilometers) at 12:56 UT. During the encounter, the spacecraft photographed 60 percent of the minor planet from a range of 750 miles (1,200 kilometers).
